title: Where does Taiwan’s future lie in the US-China tug-of-war?
description: Chinese military simulates strikes on Taiwan in response to its president's visit to the US.

title: Eight missing after buildings collapse in France’s Marseille
description: Residents are believed to be buried under the rubble, as firefighters work to extinguish flames following an explosion.

title: As Russia continues shelling, Pope Francis urges peace in Ukraine
description: Over the weekend, Russian forces reportedly launched dozens of attacks on various parts of Ukraine.

title: Ukraine likely to face bloody Crimea fight, satellite images show
description: Russian forces have been digging defensive fortifications and trenches in preparation of a Ukrainian offensive.

title: Saudi, Omani envoys in Yemen for peace talks with Houthi leaders
description: The visit displays progress in the Oman-mediated dialogue between Saudi Arabia and Yemen's Houthi rebels.

title: Israel rejects claims that Mossad backed nationwide protests
description: Government denies claims in leaked documents that its intelligence service encouraged Israelis to join demonstrations.

title: Tiger Woods withdraws from Augusta Masters due to injury
description: Five-time champion announces withdrawal after playing through pain and limping through the third round a day earlier.

title: Dozens evacuated as smoke from Hamburg fire halts trains
description: Blaze engulfs toxic chemicals, sending black smoke over the German city, as residents warned to close their windows.

title: Under Netanyahu, violence against Christians is being normalised
description: Never have Israeli attackers felt more emboldened than under the new government, Christian leaders say.

title: India’s Indigenous people pay price of tiger conservation
description: Several Adivasi groups say the conservation strategies mean uprooting numerous communities from forests.

title: India’s tiger population tops 3,000, survey finds
description: Efforts to revive India's tiger population began 50 years ago over fears the big cats were going extinct.

title: Adesanya gets ‘sweet revenge’ with knockout UFC win over Pereira
description: Israel Adesanya reclaims middleweight championship from Alex Pereira at UFC 287 in Miami.

title: Ukraine’s coal miners dig deep to power a nation at war
description: Ukrainian miners work around the clock extracting coal to power the country's war effort.

title: Q&A: Noam Chomsky on Palestine, Israel and the state of the world
description: The renowned US academic also spoke to Al Jazeera about his career and positions he regrets not taking in the past.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 410
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 410th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: How death and despair haunt Pakistan’s Christian minority
description: Pakistan's Christians have long been marginalised and pushed into sewer cleaning work. Now, some are fighting back.

title: The US should not worry about China-Gulf relations
description: But it should be nervous about how close Israel has grown to Beijing.

title: China simulates ‘strikes on targets in Taiwan’ as drills continue
description: Taiwan's defence ministry says it spotted 70 Chinese aircraft and 11 warships on second day of drills around the island.

title: The Deir Yassin massacre: Why it still matters 75 years later
description: Brutal attacks by Zionist militias on Deir Yassin killed at least 107 Palestinians and made thousands flee other towns.

title: Iraq demands Turkey apologise over attack on Sulaimaniyah airport
description: SDF commander Mazloum Abdi says he was in a convoy with US troops at the Sulaimaniyah airport at time of attack.

title: Saudi Arabia frees 13 Houthis as Oman tries to broker new truce
description: Saudi Arabia, Houthis exchange prisoners as Omani officials arrive in Sanaa for talks to end Yemen's years-long war.

title: Israel launches artillery attacks on Syria after rocket fire
description: Israeli army says six rockets were fired from Syria towards Israel, one of which landed in the annexed Golan Heights.
